name: Antbull Exquisite Relics #4 - Angelim - Andira anthelmia
description:
Characteristics: pivoting root tree, globose crown, ornamental foliage and semi-deciduous leaves. Expressive pink flowering from October to November. Fruiting occurs from February to March and is attractive to birds.
 
Observations: pioneer species, typical of Restinga ecosystems and hillside forests, indicated for the recovery of degraded areas. Its growth is moderate and the seedling is easy to produce. Likes full exposure to the sun and clay soil.
